Memorandum by the Minister cf Health.At a meeting of the Cabinet on the 26th April my Memorandum (CP.2868) with regard to Relief at the Cost of the Rates in Colliery Districts was discussed, and it was decided that no decision could be taken without the concurrence of the Chancellor of the Exchequer. In accordance with this decision, Idisoussed the question with the Chancellor last Friday, the 29th April, and he agreed to leave the matter entirely in my hands for me to procoed on the basis of the suggestions in my Memorandum. I have, therefore, given instructions in my Department that the soale suggested In the penultimate paragraph of my Memorandum should be adopted, In accordance with the agreement on the points of principle reached by the Cabinet on the 21ttt April.The legal issues involved are being referred to the Law Officers.ALFRED MOM)., 4th May, 1921.Ministry of Health.
